verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,
verses.web: The word that came to Jeremiah from LORD, saying,
verses.ct: This is the message that came to Jeremiah from the LORD:

verses.kjv: Hear ye the words of this covenant, and speak unto the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.web: “Hear the words of this covenant, and speak to the men of Judah, and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem;
verses.ct: "Listen to the words of this covenant, and then go speak them to the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And say thou unto them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel; Cursed be the man that obeyeth not the words of this covenant,
verses.web: and say to them, LORD, the God of Israel says: ‘Cursed is the man who doesn’t hear the words of this covenant,
verses.ct: Tell them that the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'Cursed is anyone who refuses to obey the terms of this covenant —

verses.kjv: Which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, from the iron furnace, saying, Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your God:
verses.web: which I commanded your fathers in the day that I brought them out of the land of Egypt, out of the iron furnace,’ saying, ‘Obey my voice, and do them, according to all which I command you; so you shall be my people, and I will be your God;
verses.ct: the covenant I gave your ancestors when I brought them out of Egypt, out of that iron furnace of slavery. I told them: Obey me and follow every command I give you. If you do, you will be my people, and I will be your God —

verses.kjv: That I may perform the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, as it is this day. Then answered I, and said, So be it, O LORD.
verses.web: that I may establish the oath which I swore to your fathers, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey,’ as it is today.” Then I answered, and said, “Amen, LORD.”
verses.ct: so that I can fulfill the oath I swore to your ancestors, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey.' And that's the land you live in today." I answered, "Amen, LORD."

verses.kjv: Then the LORD said unto me, Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, Hear ye the words of this covenant, and do them.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, saying, ‘Hear the words of this covenant, and do them.
verses.ct: Then the LORD told me, "Go proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem. Say to them: 'Listen to the terms of this covenant and obey them.

verses.kjv: For I earnestly protested unto your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even unto this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.
verses.web: For I earnestly protested to your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even to this day, rising early and protesting, saying, “Obey my voice.”
verses.ct: From the day I brought your ancestors out of Egypt until now, I have warned them again and again, urgently and persistently, saying: Obey me.

verses.kjv: Yet they obeyed not, nor inclined their ear, but walked every one in the imagination of their evil heart: therefore I will bring upon them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do: but they did them not.
verses.web: Yet they didn’t obey, nor turn their ear, but everyone walked in the stubbornness of their evil heart. Therefore I brought on them all the words of this covenant, which I commanded them to do, but they didn’t do them.’ ”
verses.ct: But they didn't listen. They didn't pay attention. Instead, every one of them followed the stubborn desires of their evil hearts. So I brought down on them every consequence this covenant spells out — the commands I gave them to follow, which they ignored.'"

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.web: LORD said to me, “A conspiracy is found among the men of Judah, and among the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to me, "There is a conspiracy among the people of Judah and the residents of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: They are turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, which refused to hear my words; and they went after other gods to serve them: the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
verses.web: They have turned back to the iniquities of their forefathers, who refused to hear my words. They have gone after other gods to serve them. The house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken my covenant which I made with their fathers.
verses.ct: They've gone back to the same sins as their ancestors, who refused to listen to my words. They've chased after other gods and worshiped them. Both the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their fathers."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon them, which they shall not be able to escape; and though they shall cry unto me, I will not hearken unto them.
verses.web: Therefore LORD says, ‘Behold, I will bring evil on them, which they will not be able to escape; and they will cry to me, but I will not listen to them.
verses.ct: So the LORD says, "Watch — I am going to bring disaster on them that they won't be able to escape. They will cry out to me, but I will not listen.

verses.kjv: Then shall the cities of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem go, and cry unto the gods unto whom they offer incense: but they shall not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
verses.web: Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry to the gods to which they offer incense, but they will not save them at all in the time of their trouble.
verses.ct: Then the cities of Judah and the people of Jerusalem will run to the gods they've been burning incense to and beg for help. But those gods won't save them — not even a little — when disaster strikes.

verses.kjv: For according to the number of thy cities were thy gods, O Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have ye set up altars to that shameful thing, even altars to burn incense unto Baal.
verses.web: For according to the number of your cities are your gods, Judah; and according to the number of the streets of Jerusalem have you set up altars to the shameful thing, even altars to burn incense to Baal.’
verses.ct: Judah, you have as many gods as you have cities! And the people of Jerusalem have set up altars on every street corner to that shameful idol — altars for burning incense to Baal."

verses.kjv: Therefore pray not thou for this people, neither lift up a cry or prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time that they cry unto me for their trouble.
verses.web: “Therefore don’t pray for this people. Don’t lift up cry or prayer for them; for I will not hear them in the time that they cry to me because of their trouble.
verses.ct: "So don't pray for these people, Jeremiah. Don't cry out or plead on their behalf, because I will not listen when they call to me in the middle of their disaster.

verses.kjv: What hath my beloved to do in mine house, seeing she hath wrought lewdness with many, and the holy flesh is passed from thee? when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.
verses.web: What has my beloved to do in my house, since she has behaved lewdly with many, and the holy flesh has passed from you? When you do evil, then you rejoice.”
verses.ct: What right does my beloved people have to be in my temple when they've committed so many disgusting acts? Can sacred offerings remove your guilt? You actually celebrate while doing evil!"

verses.kjv: The LORD called thy name, A green olive tree, fair, and of goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he hath kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken.
verses.web: LORD called your name, “A green olive tree, beautiful with goodly fruit.” With the noise of a great roar he has kindled fire on it, and its branches are broken.
verses.ct: The LORD once called you "a beautiful olive tree, full of lush fruit." But now, with the roar of a mighty storm, he has set that tree on fire, and its branches are snapping and breaking.

verses.kjv: For the LORD of hosts, that planted thee, hath pronounced evil against thee, for the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done against themselves to provoke me to anger in offering incense unto Baal.
verses.web: For LORD of Armies, who planted you, has pronounced evil against you, because of the evil of the house of Israel and of the house of Judah, which they have done to themselves in provoking me to anger by offering incense to Baal.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies, the one who planted you, has declared disaster against you. This is because of the evil that both the house of Israel and the house of Judah have brought on themselves — provoking the LORD to anger by burning incense to Baal.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath given me knowledge of it, and I know it: then thou shewedst me their doings.
verses.web: LORD gave me knowledge of it, and I knew it. Then you showed me their doings.
verses.ct: The LORD revealed it to me, and then I understood. He showed me exactly what they were doing.

verses.kjv: But I was like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter; and I knew not that they had devised devices against me, saying, Let us destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.
verses.web: But I was like a gentle lamb that is led to the slaughter. I didn’t know that they had devised plans against me, saying, “Let’s destroy the tree with its fruit, and let’s cut him off from the land of the living, that his name may be no more remembered.”
verses.ct: I had been like a gentle lamb led to the slaughter, completely unaware that they were plotting against me. They were saying, "Let's destroy the tree along with its fruit. Let's cut him off from the land of the living so that no one even remembers his name."

verses.kjv: But, O LORD of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the reins and the heart, let me see thy vengeance on them: for unto thee have I revealed my cause.
verses.web: But, LORD of Armies, who judges righteously, who tests the heart and the mind, I will see your vengeance on them; for to you I have revealed my cause.
verses.ct: But LORD of Armies, you judge with righteousness. You examine the heart and the mind. Let me see you take vengeance on them, because I've placed my case in your hands.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of the men of Anathoth, that seek thy life, saying, Prophesy not in the name of the LORD, that thou die not by our hand:
verses.web: “Therefore LORD says concerning the men of Anathoth, who seek your life, saying, ‘You shall not prophesy in LORD’s name, that you not die by our hand;’
verses.ct: So the LORD spoke about the men of Anathoth who were trying to kill me. They had warned me, "Stop prophesying in the name of the LORD, or we'll kill you with our own hands."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts, Behold, I will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons and their daughters shall die by famine:
verses.web: therefore LORD of Armies says, ‘Behold, I will punish them. The young men will die by the sword. Their sons and their daughters will die by famine.
verses.ct: Because of this, the LORD of Armies says, "I will punish them. Their young men will die by the sword. Their sons and daughters will die from famine.

verses.kjv: And there shall be no remnant of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.
verses.web: There will be no remnant to them, for I will bring evil on the men of Anathoth, even the year of their visitation.’ ”
verses.ct: Not a single one of them will survive, because I am bringing disaster on the men of Anathoth when the time comes for their punishment."
